name: Friuli
aroma: Bright notes of citrus, white peach, pear and spring flowers
taste: Complex and layered with ripe peach, pear, citrus and a mouth filling texture with crisp mineral finish. 20-45 years old, planted at 4,500 vines/hectare over 240 acres. Estate grown and hand-harvested in whole clusters.

name: Santa Christina
aroma: On the nose it is rich with fruity notes of morello cherries, aromatic herbs and balsamic sensations.
taste: Its palate is soft, mouth filling with velvety tannins and a long savory finish.

name: Silver Label
aroma: Characteristic aromas of Barbera, with a flowery and fruity bouquet.
taste: A full, persistent taste which is nicely dry and velvety.
